review_title: A Simple VR Rythem Horror Masterpiece
one_reviews_text: It's such a unique experince and though I am sure it translates well to traditional play experience it's something so intresting in VR. Rythem Violence is an accurate description with a touch of never ending dred. You'll be left wondering what's coming around the next twisted bend in this nightmare world. I can only hope the developers release some DLC as this will leave you wanting more.

review_title: Took some time to get hang of..
one_reviews_text: But well worth it!! Great game to play seated. Trippy visuals and soundtrack. Unique gameplay and addictive.
Really great experience!

review_title: The VR Game You didn't know you NEEDED
one_reviews_text:
By far the best VR game out there. Extremely responsivie. Completely gripping. Takes you on a journey where you naturally progress. The controls are intuitive and introduction is gradual for a smooth flowing experience. 

If you want a good rythm VR game then this is it. I've got beat saber and audioshield and obviously they are different but this is a well thought out and considered game. Hands down this game can't be beaten.

I usually spend half hour on a VR game before I lose interest. This is one not to be missed. 

Also worth noting I more often than not get motion sickness with VR games so this was a gamble but actually no issue at all with that. 

Congrats on what must be the best VR game out there!

This game is fatally flawed. The controls don't work half the time so you end up dying endlessly. Also, you can do the same thing 5 times in a row successfully, but the sixth time you will fail--doing the exact same thing. Why you ask? Well, the developers decided to give you no instructions/no clue on how the game works or what you're supposed to do. So you'll never find out.  And to make it more fun for you the game will endlessly loop over and over and over and over and over and over and over --with you doing the same thing that worked the first 5 times but no longer does. So you endlessly die with no hope of ever advancing . And if you should somehow, someday stumble upon the solution--don't worry, the controls will stop working and you'll die anyway. This is without a doubt the worst game I have ever played and it isn't even close. Save your money.

Bought this for the Go and enjoyed it and decided to give the Rift version a try. They both have a place but the graphics and sound on the Rift are blowing me away. I’m only on Level 3 and playing daily. My favorite game at this moment!
Repeats never get boring.
I am the beetle, and I will not be stopped. The unspeakable head of desolation will know this in time.

This game really stresses you out.  So much so that I mashed my right touch controller's "A" button a bit too hard.

Oh well, guess it was time for a new controller.

Great game!
Suprisingly fun little game. I top out at level 4 atm but those first 3 levels are amazing.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=YkLmeA7L7xc
(Links do not work with oculus at the moment so search YouTube for 'Paradise Decay VR Thumper'

My Thoughts:
A superb rhythm based experience and even better in VR!

This will be the best rhythm game you've ever played. Except you might not notice that it's a rhythm game at first. Everything about this game is unconventional and designed to make you uncomfortable. I found myself staring at the title screen for a solid 3 minutes thinking it was going to be a linear experience before I realized I was supposed to push a button. That means these 3 minutes were already captivating. What can I say. This game has superb sound design, polished entrancing visuals, and a flawless, fear-inducing game experience. It's like a rhythm game disguised as a continuous, terrifying, ever-accelerating barrel down a clamped down shoot of horror. Or is it the other way around? I can't decide. Do this while you're high and make sure you wear a pace maker.

I already played Thumper on PSVR and was blown away. Bought it a second time for the Rift and didn't regret it. Describing it as a rhythm violence game is absolutely justified. Graphics, sound and gameplay harmonizing so well... it's almost like meditative tunnelvision. Be warned: The game gets really tough around level 5. 
And turn up the sound!

Now please Jeff Minter give us Polybius for the Rift!
Brilliant game. Having a heap of fun with this one.

beautiful game with an ominous atmosphere, and nice heavy sounds. if you're even a little curious about the game from the trailer/screenshots, then don't hesitate - it's a great experience. play it sitting down.

i can't stop wondering how these visuals and atmosphere (including the sound and violent movements) were initially even imagined, let alone articulated and coordinated with a team of game designers/developers. it's an amazing achievement.
Trippy pyscholedic game. Got it on sale, I High-ly endorse this game.
Its a lot of fun and trippy forms, colors and sound.

I'm really suprised this game is not more popular. I was going to shell out the full $20, but instead caught it on sale for $8. It has been the best $8 I have ever spent. This game is hard, musical, and, dare I say it, trippy as @#$%!!! The best description of it would be an interactive Space Mountain. Don't get me wrong, the game gets incredibly difficult, but it just adds to the amount of playability. I have sunk several hours into this game at a time and am still no where near the end. If you want an incredible, music-based game that will give you a lasting experience and a great deal of replayability, look no further. This is the game for you. If you're not looking for anything like that, then you just haven't figured out it's exactly the perfect experience for vr. I am farily senitive to a lot of the motion sickness and this game has never given me any. I highly recommend!!!!

Incredibly exciting track rollercoaster adventure,
Charging faster and faster through dark abstract dimensions!!!
Interesting and intricate rhythmic combos and awesome boss battles!!
A tough game I havent progressed that far through, but what I have seen is very impressive!!!
Recommend playing this one sitting down!!!

If you want to try out rhythm games, this one is an amazing first try. If you love rhythm games, this one will give you a big grin through the whole time you play. The pumping and thrilling music + the unique and stunning visuals are mind blowing. This is a no-brainer. BUY IT!
Awesome rhythm game. The bosses are super trippy
Nice game, awesome graphics, decent sound track
This felt like a VR version of drugs, not that I'd know... It gets a little too hard for me eventually, but I can always go back and chill in the easy levels to the sweet beats and visuals :-)

This is untill now the best game i've played!
it's sharp in terms of graphical quality and has great fast pace action to it. I find that all the shooting games and game where you have to teleport are so...limited. if you're playing a game where you have to sit  I think you still have to be able to feel free.  Thumper makes up for this by beiing super fast and offer an interesting way of playing a game in VR.  I'd say try it and be amazed. 5/5 stars!!!

review_title: I have 30+ games, first game I'll review
one_reviews_text:
This is the first Oculus game that keeps me coming back for more (I have a problem with giving up on games due to boredom, other than Onward).

If you like games like Audiosurf, Soundboxing or any type of rythmic game and you really want a challange, this is it. I can't see a game that could be better than this. I would say that it is probably the most difficult and rewarding game I've ever played, VR or not. For some reason I keep on starting games and never finsh them on the Oculus, but this one was different. Loved it. 

Tips of developers: I would pay a monthly subscription if I had to if you could incorporate real music from YouTube or Google Play music into the tracks... I can't believe a game like that doesn't exist yet. It would be a 60 dollar game or a 5 dollar a month subscription. Great job!
but the amount of details they put in is AMAZING

Thumper is one of my favorite VR experiences. It is a rhythm based game where you navigate through tracks and dodge the various obstacles in your way. The controls are spot on and the game is such a rush. There are a total of 9 stages and the game does a great job of adding speed to the tracks and introducing you to new obstacles as you progress through each level. The visuals and sound are really high quality as well. I highly recommend this game!
Probably one of the best vr game ever!! I love it even though it's a little complicated sometimes!
Unlike the PS4 version of this game, this one does not save your progress which means you always have to start at level one when you play it.  Epic fail to what was a great game.  Skip this.
If you like rhythm based games with an very angry undertone, then you will love this.  The speed of the game really gets your heart pounding.  Highly recommend
When playing Thumper you experience flow like in few other games. Really cool and gets pretty challenging. Love it!

Amazing game. This was both beautiful and haunting at the same time. It felt like mankind discovering something completely beyond our understanding and intelligence in space, the kind of dread and hopelessness that would follow whilst you are overcome by awe and admiration. There are 9 stages to play, which i completed one per day as the experience was too good to rush in one sitting. Felt like it was made for vr, couldn't play this game without it.

review_title: I was on the fence but loved it
one_reviews_text:
Contrary to some negative reviews that say the gameplay does not follow the music rhythm.. it totally does. I can play the drums, so I know a bit about basic rhythm feeling and theory. In this game 99% of the gameplay triggers ARE related to the music rhythm, yes. Being in rhythm does not simply mean "trigger during the 1-2-3-4 beats". There's half-beats and even 1/4-beats to account for, and that is still rhythmic, and feels nice and natural during gameplay. The performance is butter smooth. The ambiance is awesome (somewhat serious, futuristic abstract stuff).

Whenever you mess up (if you are seeking for a perfect "S" rank) you just press L-Trigger, Down, A, then in less than one second you are back at the last checkpoint - REALLY nice!

I would be even happier if the music tone were a bit darker (as I was expecting after reading all reviews praising the music as horror-themed). The music IS nice, and a bit horror-ish, but it could be a bit darker still. All in all, very very polished game, and challenging.

Worth it.

review_title: Existential Tension - I love this game
one_reviews_text: I bought it on a whim for the sale and don't regret it. I've been looking for a game like this. Rhythm based action that makes you want to move your body as you play, and makes you want to strive for perfection just to hear those beats hit perfecly. The gameplay mechanics were simple and flawless in my eyes.

So I have just beaten level 4, but especially the last boss was almost unbeatable, because of a bug that returned me to the lain that I switched away from. It resulted in multible tries where I had to fight the controller just to be able to not die by the bug... I just hope this isn't going to be a problem later on.
Great fast paced game, with no motion sickness. But gets quite challenging quite fast.
Played it before on the PSVR and bought it now for my CV1. It´s a great game and it has a meditative side to it, even though it can get very challenging. Must-have

review_title: the beetle makes me go awwwww
one_reviews_text: wow... just wish there was binaural sound to match it, would increase immersion of these 3d music vids :)

review_title: Best seated oculus experience I've had
one_reviews_text: Its an incredible game not specifically made with VR in mind but it fits in perfectly. The game gets more difficult at just the right pace and is a joy to play. It does get difficult when you try to reach that high score but doesnt cause much frustration, rather makes you want to try again and get that extra point or two. Picked it up during the sale, but I'd say its worth it even without it.
Buyed the game and the game wont launch. It crashes before start. All my other installed games work fine.

I was a bit nervous getting this one. I wanted to try it out, but was a bit skeptical that it was of moderate comfort level.  It's definitely the most comfortable I've been in any game moving this fast.  The visuals are awesome, and the gameplay keeps you engrossed as well.  The auto quick restart after losing gives it that super meat boy feel, no time to be frustrated at the difficulty, you're trying again!

This game is really fun to play even after I've owned it for a few months now.  The industrial techno music seems to match the abstract nature nicely.  They will sometimes make you do things that are off beat occasionally and it will throw you off from time to time.  A dubstep version of this game would be awesome...and evil at the same time lol.
Nice graphic and decent concept yett very short and repettitive gameplay. The price is to high and the fuss about it to big.

Playing this game surprised me. I didn't think a gamepad game would entice me after using Oculus Touch for so long. It's truly mezmerising and addictive. It's a very trippy game and VR let's you see the depth of it all and really take in the details. Very well done game.
Wow!! is all I can say, I finally picked this game up and it is absolutely intense, with so many good games around, this is unique and exactly what I've been waiting for in VR, totally immense!!

Fantastic rhythm game with great style. Simple but addictive gameplay. The game really pulls you in, its like a strange dream/nightmare, Very surreal. If you like games like REZ, DJ Hero or Vib-Ribbon, its for you. ;-)

Simple, but engrossing gameplay. Nice, psychedelic visuals, and compelling audio. I do wish they'd add gamepad emulation with Oculus Touch controllers, but it's not enough to knock a star off the rating.
it would be ok for 5 bucks, but not more. The "music" starts quiet boring and after level 3 its getting annoying. Sorry but there are much better music games on the market.
This game is so good! Everyone I have play it really loves it. The only thing that is not great is that it can get really hard.
Really enjoyable game, possibly the most intense experience i've had in VR so far. Parts of it seem a tad stagnant, but overall it's extremely solid and inventive in design.

The greatest moments in this game are when your actions create a catchy drumbeat. Unfortunately, the majority of your actions end up feeling completely unrelated to the time signature and drum beat that's driving the experience. I often asked my self, "are they intentionally trying to make the experience more difficult by placing the timing of my actions off from what could have been a feel good rythm, or do they have no idea what they're doing?" I assume it's the former, which I feel was a bad choice.

There were some sections that I would love to play over and over as I rock to the timing and the groove. Sadly, the majority of sections feel random instead, as though the composer prioritized being tricky over writing enjoyable beats.

I'm torn between a 3 and a 4 for this game. If you prefer abstract drum beats instead of solid grooves, this might be a five for you. 

As a groove drummer, I'll still give it a four, because it held my attention longer than any other game on the Oculus rift.

Developers, I would love to see another game like this that prioritizes enjoyable beats over abstract complication.

This game is like dropping acid and listening to The Wall at half speed.  This game is like if H.R. Giger and the guy who does lighting for KISS concerts made a rhythm game.  This game is like being trapped inside a kaleidoscope made of chrome and human souls.  This game is like being strapped to the hood of a muscle car playing Tool drum tracks and doing 180 on the wrong side of the free way.  This game is like being tied down while a beautiful but terrifying queen slowly eats your ears off.  This game is like being melted down and poured into a subwoofer.  This game is like being strapped to a rocket and fired into a hot ball of pure sound.  Play at maximum volume.
Intense, addictive, every goal is a new challenge.
Once you feel the rythm, this becomes an addiction that is beautiful and incredible. A must purchase game.
Love it! It's ultra-fast and ultra-furious!

Good fun to be had here although some of the levels are very difficult. Sometimes frustrating but when your blsting along and everything is going right for you the game feels amazing. Recommended download.
It looks like a very cool game but it wouldnt start on my pc. Its hard to find game that im able to play being in a wheelchair. but will try uninstalling and reinstall and see if it help.

What an excelent, excelent rythem game. Absoutly mindblowing and now one of my favorite games of all time! If you like pressing buttons to music and giving yourself a challenge, you need to play this. For me, this is a game worth at least 40 bucks, at 20 its a steal! I've only just finished it and now im onto +Mode. Thank you devs for creating such a fun, beautiful, polished and challenging game.
I've never really gotten into runners, but I couldn't put this one down. Classic formula of "easy to learn, difficult to master". 3/8

review_title: A must have for rhythm game fans
one_reviews_text:
This game is absolutely amazing. The visuals are out of this world and the gameplay is rich and diverse. As a Guitar Hero Insane level player I was worried that this game might be too easy after seeing gameplay of the first couple of stages, but that is not the case. The game is very chalanging and in return very much rewarding. Make sure you've got your VR legs before playing this game.
This is one of the games which for me enduce a feeling of: "how do I share this experience with someone else". Well... this is me sharing this experience with you. Enjoy, put the volume on max and be prepared to having a sore thumb.

I dont really understand the hype for this game.  It feels decidedly average and if the store allowed for refunds i think i would take it.  Which is in stark contrast to the hype people have been pumping about this.

Highly recommended. Its simple enough to pick up and start and the game play will make you crawl back for more. My go to game when I want a good seated game. Very friendly for friends to pick up level one and get sucked in.

I have no idea what the fudge is going on, but within minutes I knew exactly what to do.  Do yourself a favor buy a Subpac and this game and forget about any rollercoaster simulator you may have every tried and strap yourself in for an expierence.

Wow! I was the lawnmower Man.. NO. No. I'm more than that now.

EDIT: 
This game is awesome. It doesnt give much away at first. You have to let it teach you what to do by making mistakes. This game is obvioisly made by developers that are thinking of new consepts outside the box (or in the tunnel) for VR. Get it now!

Looking at all the great reviews jumped on it imidiately but I must say was pretty dissapointed by this game. After 5 mins just got bored and not worth the money I paid for. There is better in the VR world
this game is simple  but yet super fast the music goes really will put you in combat mode lol... I hope they make more games like this, Way Better in VR!!!!

For crafting a brutal yet beautiful granite and steel masterpiece so compelling that I actually put down my beloved touch controllers to play this. Not normally my cup of tea at all but have been following this since it was released and hoping the VR version would meet expectations. Blown away by how good this is.

This was by far the best game I played on my friend's PSVR and I bought it as soon as I saw it was available.  This would be a great game with or without VR, but the VR adds another level to the already high tension.  If you even kind of like rythym games, just buy it.  It's so different and unique.
I was skeptical whether this would really be worth $20. Just based off the screenshots and what I imagined the game to be. Consider me blown away.

review_title: Roller Coaster on too much Acid...
one_reviews_text: Title says all - this game scares me... in a good way :P

An intense, visceral experience. Reminiscent of Dyad. The visual style is effective and unique. I'd love to see more visually abstract VR experiences like this. I wish the far-off, presumably large objects in this game felt bigger though.
Unique, perfect and crazy rythym game. Top 3 best games in 2016. Probably best VR game for me and i have 90% of the Oculus library. The real challenge start at level 3.
No game without touch support on my pc...That's what i thought yesterday. But holy Moly, that game is amazing. High five to the devs. Great job! All you VR Nerds out there...BUY IT!

I have to say that this game is really special if you have ever played or been very close to music.  It is intense, but in a good way and once you find the rhythm it is almost like calm within the storm :)
buyitbuyitbuyitbuyitbuyitbuyit!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
Fun and nice design
Great game! amazing visuals & really fun
Really fun!  I made it crash when I tried to make the desktop window full screen by pressing alt+enter in VR though.
I played this game on PSVR but decided to buy on the PC.  I'm not disappointed.
doesnt work plz dont buy this waste of time and money
This comines pretty much every rhytm game with fast action. 100%
A visual treat for the eyes and just WOW!
And yet so powerful ! Insane !
Just A-M-A-Z-I-N-G
